title: Should I use an inheritance to pay off my student loan or buy a house?
text:
Students are heading off to university this month with cash in their pockets from their loans, but even those whose undergraduate days are far behind them still have to think about their student debt.

Most people in their 20s have little dispensable income. But as they reach their 30s, they are likely to be on higher salaries and may have built up savings or inherited money from grandparents.

So, if you can afford to start paying off chunks of your student loan debt over and above the minimum repayments, should you? Or would investing it into a first home or savings products be a better financial decision?
